Hello Frank,

We didn't make any changes for this issue, because we want to continue to collect that data from the other domains.

Three of the AD_Scan's analysis tasks were throwing errors because the default SQL queries were still calling out a placeholder. Those tasked are not enabled by default, so we needed to manually update the SQL queries to include the actual name of the associated table.

One of your Domains is throwing an "LDAP server unavailable" error. We found this is because the DC Netwrix Enterprise Auditor is trying to connect to has the LDAP ports blocked. You already have a custom job you are using to create dynamic host lists. You started working on it during the meeting, but ultimately, you just need to make sure that job is filtering that domain's DCs down to only ones where the LDAP query ports are open.

The final error you are seeing is not one that I am familiar with. The error reads like a SQL query is returning more than one result, but it's then trying to use that with an operation that requires a single result. Like we discussed, I will do some research and let you know when I have additional questions or next steps.
